author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 28-year-old woman delivered triplets at the Government Vellore Medical College Hospital (GVMCH) on Wednesday.

According to doctors, Radhika, a resident of Mukkurumbai village, Polur in Tiruvannamalai, delivered a girl and two boys at the hospital. She had a normal delivery.

While the girl baby weighed 1.67 kg, the boys weighed 1.7 kg and 1.5 kg respectively, according to E. Theranirajan, head, Paediatrics, GVMCH.

Since January this year, this was the third set of triplets to be born at GVMCH, he said, adding, “All the three babies are now in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit as they were born prematurely (at 32 weeks) and are of low weight. One of the boys has been kept under ventilation. We will keep the babies under observation.”

The mother underwent her antenatal screening at the Kalambur Primary Health Centre, and ultrasound scan during the third month of pregnancy detected that she had triplets. Her husband, Balakrishnan, is a farmer.
title: GVMCH sees a hat-trick of triplets in three months
